intro: Dichaeopsis panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian dichaeopsis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its native range.
